attributes.description:
This section provides Machine Learning (ML) powered visualizations to help you assess compliance with CCI-004337, focusing on the reporting of privacy incidents. This visualization analyzes anomaly scores from an ML job that detects unusual increases in privacy-related events, such as Data Loss Prevention (DLP) alerts or access to files and paths commonly associated with sensitive data (PII, PHI).

To perform a component-level compliance assessment, utilize the global filters at the top of the Kibana dashboard. Apply filters like 'influencers.host.name: <your_component_name>' to focus on a specific system. The ML job learns the normal baseline of privacy-related events. A high anomaly score indicates a deviation that must be investigated to determine if it is a privacy incident requiring reporting under organizational policy.
attributes.title: [PM-6, CCI-004337] ML - Privacy Incidents Health Status
attributes.visState: {"title":"[PM-6, CCI-004337] ML - Privacy Incidents Health Status","type":"metric","aggs":[{"id":"1","enabled":true,"type":"max","params":{"field":"anomaly_score"},"schema":"metric"}],"params":{"addTooltip":true,"addLegend":false,"type":"metric","metric":{"percentageMode":false,"useRanges":true,"colorSchema":"Green to Red","metricColorMode":"Background","colorsRange":[{"from":0,"to":25},{"from":25,"to":75},{"from":75,"to":1000}],"labels":{"show":true},"invertColors":false,"style":{"fontSize":60,"bgColor":true}},"seriesParams":[{"data":{"id":"1","label":"Max Anomaly Score"},"show":true,"type":"metric","valueAxis":"ValueAxis-1"}]}}

attributes.description:
This table provides a detailed breakdown of the entities influencing the anomaly scores for privacy-related incidents.

**Why this visualization works:** It provides immediate, actionable context for privacy-related anomalies. Instead of just an alert, it shows the specific users accessing sensitive file paths on particular hosts, which is critical for a fast and effective response to a potential data breach or policy violation.

**How an analyst can use it:** When an anomaly is detected, this table should be the first place to look. Identify the user, host, and especially the file path involved. A high anomaly score linked to an unfamiliar user accessing a file path known to contain PII is a critical event that requires immediate escalation and investigation to determine if a reportable privacy incident has occurred.
attributes.title: [PM-6, CCI-004337] ML - Top Privacy Incident Anomaly Influencers
attributes.visState: {"title":"[PM-6, CCI-004337] ML - Top Privacy Incident Anomaly Influencers","type":"table","aggs":[{"id":"1","enabled":true,"type":"max","params":{"field":"anomaly_score","customLabel":"Max Anomaly Score"},"schema":"metric"},{"id":"2","enabled":true,"type":"terms","params":{"field":"host.name","orderBy":"1","order":"desc","size":10,"otherBucket":false,"otherBucketLabel":"Other","missingBucket":false,"missingBucketLabel":"Missing","includeIsRegex":true,"excludeIsRegex":true},"schema":"bucket"},{"id":"3","enabled":true,"type":"terms","params":{"field":"user.name","orderBy":"1","order":"desc","size":10,"otherBucket":false,"otherBucketLabel":"Other","missingBucket":false,"missingBucketLabel":"Missing","includeIsRegex":true,"excludeIsRegex":true},"schema":"bucket"},{"id":"4","enabled":true,"type":"terms","params":{"field":"file.path","orderBy":"1","order":"desc","size":10,"otherBucket":false,"otherBucketLabel":"Other","missingBucket":false,"missingBucketLabel":"Missing","includeIsRegex":true,"excludeIsRegex":true},"schema":"bucket"}],"params":{"perPage":10,"showPartialRows":false,"showMetricsAtAllLevels":false,"sort":{"columnIndex":null,"direction":null},"showTotal":false,"totalFunc":"sum","showToolbar":true,"percentageCol":"","autoFitRowToContent":false}}

attributes.description:
**Why and when this visualization works:**
This table provides the detailed, granular evidence required for any credible performance report. It moves beyond metrics to show the specific events that constitute the 'measures of performance.' This is where you can prove compliance by showing exactly what was detected.

**How an analyst can use it:**
Include this table in an appendix or as a drill-down option in your report. It allows stakeholders to see the 'who, what, and when' of each privacy incident. You can sort by any column to identify repeat issues, such as a specific user who frequently triggers DLP rules or a particular file path that is a common source of data exposure. This detail is essential for root cause analysis and for validating the effectiveness of your privacy controls.

kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON: {"query":{"language":"kuery","query":"(event.category:(file OR database OR network) AND (file.path:(*pii* OR *phi* OR *ssn* OR *financial*) OR rule.name:*privacy* OR event.code:*privacy_violation*)) OR (data_stream.dataset:*dlp*)"},"filter":[],"indexRefName":"kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON.index"}

attributes.title: [CCI-004337] Detailed Privacy Incidents

attributes.description:
This section provides visualizations designed to be the foundation for reporting on information privacy measures of performance, directly addressing CCI-004337. The visualizations below summarize key privacy-related events and trends.

**How an analyst can use it:**
1.  Assemble these visualizations onto a new or existing Kibana dashboard.
2.  To perform a component-level compliance assessment, utilize the global filters at the top of the dashboard. Apply filters like 'host.name: <your_component_name>' or 'data_stream.dataset: <your_data_source>' to focus on a specific system or data source.
3.  Use Kibana's native 'Reporting' feature found in the dashboard's toolbar to generate on-demand or scheduled reports in PDF or CSV format.
4.  These reports can then be distributed to stakeholders as required, fulfilling the obligation to 'Report on the results of information privacy measures of performance.' The visualizations provide both high-level metrics and detailed evidence suitable for comprehensive performance reviews.
attributes.title: [CCI-004337] Report Information Privacy Measures of Performance
attributes.visState: {"title":"[CCI-004337] Report Information Privacy Measures of Performance","type":"markdown","aggs":[],"params":{"markdown":"# [CCI-004337] Report on Performance Measures\n\n### Generate reports on information privacy metrics.","fontSize":12,"openLinksInNewTab":false}}

attributes.description: This visualization displays the health status of Information Privacy Measures of Performance reporting for CCI-004337. The status is determined by the maximum anomaly score from an associated Machine Learning job that detects unusual increases in privacy-related incidents. A high score indicates a significant deviation from the baseline, suggesting potential privacy events that require investigation and reporting.

attributes.description:
**Why and when this visualization works:**
This trend chart is essential for adding context to performance reports. Instead of just a single number, it shows the pattern of privacy incidents over time, helping to distinguish between a single anomalous spike and a persistent, ongoing problem. This is vital for demonstrating continuous monitoring and the effectiveness of responses.

**How an analyst can use it:**
In your report, use this chart to illustrate the narrative. Look for spikes and correlate them with known events (e.g., new deployments, policy changes). A downward trend demonstrates improving performance, while an upward trend signals a need for investigation and potential policy reinforcement. Use the time range selector to focus on periods of interest for more detailed reporting.

query.query: (event.category:(file OR database OR network) AND (file.path:(*pii* OR *phi* OR *ssn* OR *financial*) OR rule.name:*privacy* OR event.code:*privacy_violation*)) OR (data_stream.dataset:*dlp*)

attributes.title: [CCI-004337] Privacy Incident Trend (converted)

attributes.description:
**Why and when this visualization works:**
This metric provides a crucial at-a-glance summary for any performance report. It shows the total volume of detected privacy-related incidents over the selected time frame, acting as the primary Key Performance Indicator (KPI) for privacy compliance.

**How an analyst can use it:**
Use this number as the headline figure in your reports. A high or unexpectedly increasing number should trigger a deeper dive using the trend and detailed table visualizations to understand the context and formulate a response. A low or zero count is a strong indicator of effective privacy controls.

kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON: {"query":{"language":"kuery","query":"(event.category:(file OR database OR network) AND (file.path:(*pii* OR *phi* OR *ssn* OR *financial*) OR rule.name:*privacy* OR event.code:*privacy_violation*)) OR (data_stream.dataset:*dlp*)"},"filter":[],"indexRefName":"kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON.index"}

attributes.title: [CCI-004337] Total Privacy Incidents
